blogPosts.jobTitle: Software Development Manager (Supplementary Systems: Information Technology)
blogPosts.details: Responsibilities:* To identify new IT technology opportunities and manage IT software development projects, focusing on the maintenance, development and implementation of modern software systems for the organization.* Initiate and oversee IT software development projects by evaluating and monitoring business priorities., determining IT priorities and effectively allocating tasks to IT programmes while optimizing IT resources.* Coordinate and plan IT software development projects, including the approval and finalization of technical specifications.* Oversee testing and implementation of IT software development projects* Collaborate with business units on IT software development initiatives.Qualifications:* Relevant bachelor's degree or equivalent tertiary qualification or experience in IT software development* Background in financial accounting, either through qualifications or experience* Proficiency in MS Projects or comparable project management tools* At least 10 years of experience in software development* A minimum of 3 years in a management role or similar experience in IT Sofware development projectsSkills:* Strong communication skills in Afrikaans and English* Excellent organizational and project management abilities* Proven experience in developing user and software integration interfaces is essential* Familiarity with Sofware development in COBOL and IBMi operating system is advantage* Previous experience in an agriculture business environment is plus* Exceptional interpersonal skills with the ability to lead and collaborate effectively in a team

blogPosts.jobTitle: Software Development Manager - (IBM Main Systems: Information Technology)
blogPosts.details: Primary Responsibilities:* Focus on this role is to oversee and coordinate IT Software development projects for the IBMi Systems, aimed at maintaining, developing and implementing software solutions for the organization.Responsibilities:* Initiate and manage IT Software development projects for the IBMi systems, assessing business priorities and determining IT priorities, while effectively allocating tasks to IT programmes* Coordinate and plan Sofware development projects ensuring technical specifications are approved and finalized.* Oversee testing phases for the implantation of IT software development projects on the IBM system.*Collaborate with business units regarding IT Sofware development initiatives for the IBMi systemQualifications and Skills:* a relevant bachelor's degree or comparable tertiary qualification or signification experience in IT software development* Background or experience in financial accounting* Proficiency in MS projects or similar project management software* At least 10 years' experience in software development within the IBMi environment* A minimum of 3 years in a managerial role related to IT Software development projectsSkills:* Strong communication skills in Afrikaans and English* Exceptional organization skills and project management abilities* Proficient in COBOL and IBMi operating systems* Previous experience in agri-business setting is an advantage

Requirements * Valid Grade 12 Certificate* Valid Boilermaker / Fitter trade certificateResponsibilities:* General maintenance at brick manufacturing plant* Supervision of semi-skilled employees* Assist with supervising of productionKnowledge and skills required:* Min of 5 years' work experience in a PLANT WORKSHOP environment* Read write and communicate in English and Afrikaans* Welding, grinding and working with cutting torch* Manage in difficult situations, under stress and production pressures* Self driven* Required to work overtime and weekends* Must be medically fit

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND COMPETENCIES

New Business Generation (min 10-15 years external sales experience)
Degree/ National Diploma in Business Management/Marketing/Entrepreneurship or any other relevant tertiary qualification
Must be Computer Literate
Proven Sales track record within this specific geography
Must be proficient in standard Microsoft programmes.
Strong Entrepreneurial /Sales experience an advantage
Entrepreneurial personality or character traits
Proven experience in managing a multi-faceted and multi-dimensional role such as this

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND FUNCTIONS

Develop and implement a growth strategy that focus on specific market segments.
Sell and achieve monthly target & deadlines
Source, negotiate and sign new business- Grow Sanitech Brand
Build and maintain relationships with all Municipalities and Departments
Must be aware of all upcoming tenders for Municipalities and Departments
Sourcing, costing and assisting with all upcoming Tenders
Delivering of Tenders
Attending Briefing Sessions, Opening of Tenders and Debriefing Sessions for Tenders
Appealing Declined Tenders and following up on feedback
Must be active on all Municipal and Departments websites weekly to check for upcoming RFQ’s & Tenders
Know who clients current Service Providers are
Know competitors strategy/ costing
Build relations in order that Sanitech becomes the preferred supplier
Plan and set up appointments with the identified customers
Deal with clients professionally at all times
Ensure the cost associated with opening the new account are kept in line with the approved budget
Liaise with Branch Manager where necessary
Complete contract documents in detail to stream line the implementation of new contract
Work effectively alongside Ops in implementation of new contracts
Ability to conduct sales presentations to senior management and Directors at potential customers
Uphold image of company at all times
Formulate, call and plan cycle as well as daily call reports
Assist in providing knowledge and expertise to outer lying depots in region and to when required.
Formulate, call and plan cycle as well as daily call reports
Prepare proposals, quotes &/ solutions to customers with accurate costing and follow-up
Develop a healthy pipeline and keep it updated
Handle complaints and queries
Manage existing customers (From Quotation to Implementation Phase and Follow Ups)
Maintain existing customers
Work closely with other departments (Operations and accounts)
Must be able to communicate with staff and customers at all levels
Network with other companies within the Waco Group
Assisting with general branch duties from time to time
Assist with debtors when required
Selling the full scope and offering that Sanitech has to offer

KEY PERFORMANCE MEASURABLES (This involves the most important end results for which an incumbent would be held responsible)

Achieve monthly sales targets
Number of new clients brought in
Growth of business in general
Quote hit rate
Number of daily calls
Number of quote output

Salary - R65 000 + commission, company cellphone, company petrol card

Job Description:We are seeking a dedicated and caring Staff Nurse to join our team. In this role, you will provide essential nursing care to our elderly residents, ensuring their health and well-being while maintaining a safe and comfortable environment. Key Responsibilities:Administer medication and monitor residents' health conditionsAssist with daily living activities such as bathing, dressing, and mobilityCollaborate with doctors, caregivers, and families to create and implement care plnsProvide emotional support and companionship to residentsMaintain accurate health records and reportsRespond to medical emergencies and perform first aid when necessary Qualifications:Valid nursing license (RN or EN)Previous experience in elderly care or healthcare is preferredExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsExcellent communication in Afrikaans and English Compassionate, patient, and empathetic demeanorAbility to work in a team-oriented environmentFlexible with working shifts ( Day & Night Shift)  Benefits:Monthly Salary R12000 13th Cheque Pension
The ideal candidate must have the following requirements:* Previous working experience in Spray painting in a workshop* Have valid qualifications and working references* Must be available immediately

Should have experience and proficiency in the following:* AutoCAD* Inventory* Fabric & modification* Alterations and existing structural engineering* Have all the relevant certificates* Be in possession of a valid driver's license and own transport* Must be available immediately

Key Requirements:

Matric (Grade 12)
Previous experience in mixing/tinting paints is essential
Strong attention to detail
Ability to work independently and in a team
Must be able /willing to assist as a floor assistant during times when there is no paint mixing to do

Salary will be negotiable based on experience

Key Responsibilities:

Anesthesia Services:


Administer anesthesia for surgical procedures in accordance with established protocols and patient needs.
Monitor patients before, during, and after anesthesia to ensure safety and appropriate recovery.
Manage anesthesia-related emergencies as they arise.

     2.  Emergency Department Cover (Optional):

Provide daytime cover for the emergency department as needed.
Assess and manage urgent medical cases presenting to the hospital.
Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to ensure comprehensive patient care.

      3. Clinical Excellence:

Uphold high standards of clinical practice and patient safety.
Ensure accurate and timely documentation of patient records and procedural details.
Participate in continuous professional development activities to stay updated with latest medical advancements.

    4. Team Collaboration:

Work closely with surgeons, nurses, and other healthcare professionals to optimize patient outcomes.
Contribute to multidisciplinary meetings and case discussions

Qualifications and Experience:

Medical degree from a recognized institution.
Registered with the Health Professions Council of South Africa (HPCSA) as a General Practitioner.
Diploma in Anesthesia (or equivalent qualification) recognized by HPCSA.
Proven experience in providing anesthesia services in a hospital setting, preferably in a private hospital environment.
Experience or willingness to cover emergency department shifts is advantageous.

Skills and Attributes:

Strong clinical skills with a focus on anesthesia techniques and patient management.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work effectively under pressure and in a multidisciplinary team.
Commitment to delivering high-quality patient care and safety.

Requirements:

3-4 years of experience as a Project Administrator, preferably in a mining environment.
Strong organizational and communication skills.
Excellent proficiency in English (reading, writing, and speaking).
Computer literate with proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and MS Projects.
Valid driver’s license and reliable transport.
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

Key Responsibilities:

Support project management teams with administrative tasks.
Track project schedules, documentation, and ensure deadlines are met.
Prepare and maintain project reports and records.
Liaise with site teams and management to ensure smooth operations.

Requirements:* Must reside in the following areas- Rustenburg, Mooinooi, Brits or Harties* Valid driver's license is essential* Must have own vehicle* Valid grade 12 certificate* 3 Years of experience as a sales rep (not internal sales)* Knowledge of SA mining industry and mining equipment* Quality control and ISO knowledge* Mechanical engineering knowledge / experience / degree would be to your advantage* Geographical knowledge of mines within SA* Be presentable to represent the company* Must be able to go underground from time to timeComputer Programmes* MS Office (Excel, Word and E-mail)* Sage - Pastel

Experience that is required:* Inventory Management- Capture ordered materials / components etc. in Pastel Partner with goods received note and ensure the correct order has been received- Maintain accurate records of inventory levels, including stock counts, deliveries and returns- Implement efficient stock rotation and optimize shelf space- Conduct regular audits to identify discrepancy and ensure compliance with inventory control procedures- Coordinate with suppliers to ensure timely delivery of merchandise and resolve any issues related to stock availability or quality- Maintain minimum and max stock levels of parts, consumables components tec.- Following up on a weekly basis outstanding purchase orders and updating feedback* Staff Supervision- Train and motivate personnel to provide exceptional service and achieve targets- Conduct performance evaluations and provide feedback to employees to support their professional development and growth within the company- Address and report any disciplinary issues or conflicts among staff members in accordance with company policies and procedures* Assisting production Manager- Assisting production manager with production processes and orders- Assisting with ad hoc admin duties- supervision over staff in the production team* health & safety - Knowledge of the occupational health & safety act- Purchasing of PPE equipment and keeping record of items bought and distributed* Computer Literacy- MS Office (Word, Excel, Word & PowerPoint)- sages - Pastel Partner* Must be bilingual in English & AfrikaansRequirements:* Must have a valid driver's license* 3 Years stock control warehouse and store management experience* Skills and knowledge will be tested in interview

Location: Northam Platinum MineSalary: R30,000 per month + R5,000 allowanceContract Length: 12 monthsAccommodation: Own accommodation requiredStart Date: ASAPRequirements:

Ability to read, understand, and interpret technical drawings and plans.
Proficient in Microsoft Projects.
Background in Project Management (advantageous).
Valid driver's license and own transport.
Fluent in Afrikaans and English.
Must have own accommodation near the site.

Key Responsibilities:

Project Scheduling & Planning: Develop and maintain project schedules using MS Project or Primavera P6.
Resource Allocation: Allocate resources (labor, equipment, materials) to meet project deadlines efficiently.
Critical Path Analysis: Track and manage critical path activities and address potential delays.
Progress Monitoring & Reporting: Record progress deviations and present reports to management and stakeholders.
Collaboration: Coordinate with engineers, construction managers, subcontractors, and suppliers.
Cost & Time Management: Align project schedules with budgets, monitor cost/time variances, and recommend corrective actions.
Risk Management: Identify scheduling risks and develop mitigation strategies.
Change Management: Manage schedule changes due to unforeseen circumstances and update stakeholders.
Compliance: Ensure the project schedule adheres to safety, environmental, and legal regulations specific to mining.
Quality Assurance: Integrate quality assessments into the project schedule and coordinate inspections.
Stakeholder Communication: Serve as a key contact for schedule-related queries and conduct schedule review meetings.

Qualifications:

Education: National Senior Certificate (Matric or similar)
Experience: Basic computer skills and the ability to recognize trends and anomalies in operational data.
Other Requirements:

Valid Driver’s License
Basic first aid and firefighting skills (preferred)



Key Responsibilities:

Plant Operation & Monitoring:

Monitor and control all operational parameters using SCADA.
Operate machinery, follow start-up/shut-down procedures, and log operational data.
Visually monitor effluent and feed streams; conduct effluent and gas sampling.
Report critical production figures and anomalies.


Maintenance:

Perform preventative maintenance and troubleshoot equipment.
Attend to breakdowns and maintain housekeeping standards on-site.
Manage contractors and complete equipment checklists.


Stock Control:

Monitor raw material usage and manage spare parts stock.
Ensure clean, organized storage areas.


Laboratory Work:

Conduct lab tests, record results, and manage lab consumables.
Maintain lab equipment and coordinate external testing.


Health & Safety:

Adhere to H&S procedures, maintain the H&S file, and report incidents.
Regularly check safety equipment (fire equipment, spill kits, etc.).


Admin & Supply Chain Support:

Assist with clock-in/out, manage overtime reconciliation, office supplies, and supplier communications.



If you have the ability to troubleshoot effectively in a team, are keen on working shifts, and meet the qualifications listed above, we want to hear from you!

Requirements

Safety Officer with Blasting Ticket
Must be an underground Blasting Ticket
Must have own accommodation
Must have Grade 12
Must have relevant qualifications
Must be Computer literate, experience in Isometrix
Must have valid Drivers License

Responsibilities

Safety Inspections and audits
Risk Assessments
Training and education
Incident investigation
Emergency response
Safety equipment management
Regulatory compliance
Health and safety programs
Communication
Record keeping
Continuous improvement
At least 5 years experience

Salary - R28 000 gross, plus overtime, R8000 housing allowance

Required Qualifications and Experience must be met:* At least 5 years' experience in a similar role is essential* Proficiency in Excel is necessary, including knowledge of lookup and sum product formulas and the ability to create various schedules* Experience with Evolution is a plus* Strong skills in variance analysis are required* Collaborate closely with the finance department to meet monthly deadlines* A minimum of a BCom accounting degree is required, an honor's degree and completed articles are to be met.Primary Responsibilities would be but not limited to:* Monthly reconciliation* Assessment management* Cashbook and bank reconciliation management* Integrity of financial information* VAT Management* Accounts Receivable Management* Intern and annual audits* Annual and Ad-hoc tasksKindly send cv with relevant certificates to yolanda@propersonnel.co.za

Qualifications and requirements:* Valid grade 12 certificate* 5 - 10 years general management experience* 5 - 10 years' experience in a similar environment will be advantageous* Must be medically fit* MUST HAVE A VALID DRIVERS LISENCE AND OWN TRANSPORT - (NON-NEGOTIABLE)Skills and Attributes:* Strong communication, leadership and management abilities* Exceptional interpersonal skills for building effective relationships* Keen attention to detail* Proficient in problem solving and decision making* Strong admin skills with above average computer literacy - MS Office* Ability to handle the physical demands of walking throughout the unit or village* High emotional intelligenceDuties would be but not limited to:* Operations* Finances* Staff management* Marketing and sales* Assest management* Projects* Compliances* Communications* Office administration* Resident InteractionKindly send cv with relevant certificates to yolanda@propersonnel.co.za

Requirements:* A relevant degree of diploma in Radiography or Sonography* Proven experience in a radiology setting with proficiency un ultrasound imaging preferred for Sonographers* Valid registration with the relevant health professional council* Strong communication and interpersonal skills * Ability to work efficiently in a team environment and manage multiple tasksResponsibilities:* Perform a range of diagnostic imaging procedures, including X-rays, CT scans, MRI ultrasounds and other related modalities* Ensure patient safety and comfort during imaging procedures* Maintain accurate patient records and imaging reports* Collaborate with physicians and other healthcare professionals to ensure hospital policies and regulatory requirements

Key Responsibilities:

Perform a range of diagnostic imaging procedures, including X-rays,. CT Scans, MRI,  ultrasounds, and other related modalities.
Ensure patient safety and comfort during imaging procedures.
Maintain accurate patient records and imaging reports.
Collaborate with physicians and other healthcare professionals to ensure optimal patient outcomes.
Adhere to all safety and quality standards in accordance with hospital policies and regulatory requirements.

Requirements:

A relevant degree or diploma in Radiography or Sonography.
Proven experience in a radiology setting, with proficiency in ultrasound imaging preferred for Sonographers.
Valid registration with the relevant health professions council.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment and manage multiple tasks.

Salary - R 40 000 – R 60 000 per/month (dependent on experience)

Key Responsibilities:

Welcoming and assisting patients upon arrival.
Managing patient bookings, phone calls, and email inquiries.
Maintaining patient records and ensuring their confidentiality.
Coordinating with medical staff and other departments within the hospital.
Handling general office administration tasks.

Requirements:

Proven experience as a receptionist or in an administrative role within the medical field, preferably in radiology.
Proficiency in using medical software for scheduling and patient record management.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

Salary - R 10 000 – R 20 000 per/month  (dependent on experience)

Requirements need to be met:* Proven experience as a receptionist or administrator with previous experience in a MEDICAL field.* Proficiency in using medical Sofware for scheduling and patient record management* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills* Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment* Strong organizational skills and attention to detailResponsibilities would be but not limited to:* Welcoming and assisting patients upon arrival* Managing patient bookings, phone calls and email enquiries* Maintaining patient records and ensuring their confidentiality* Coordinating with medical staff and other departments within the hospital* Handling general office administrative duties

Without exception, the successful candidate will demonstrate outstanding attention to detail, have excellent problem-solving abilities and quality control of the highest standard. The successful candidate will understand and demonstrate how to manage Clients and Projects of International stature. The successful candidate will also demonstrate a deep-seated passion for our organizational culture and brand aspiration of "Greening Africa One Project at a Time". The capacity to diligently, efficiently and effectively manage complex projects, timelines and scenarios will need to be clearly demonstrated as will an inspirational, can-do and people focused leadership ability. Core qualifications, skills sets and experience must include:

Post Graduate Science or Engineering degree in environmental or similar field
Must have successfully managed and completed (as a lead) at least 5 Green Star Certifications
Must be qualified as an Accredited Professional with the Green Building Council of South Africa (GBCSA).
Must be a Team player
Critical thinking and obsessive attention to detail
Good project management and people skills
Exemplary work ethic and not afraid to muck in to get the job done
Must be tough and have the ability to beat deadlines

 The position is in-house, and Cape Town based and may include travel across Africa

Without exception, the successful candidate will demonstrate outstanding attention to detail, have excellent problem-solving abilities and quality control of the highest standard. The successful candidate will understand and demonstrate how to manage Clients and Projects of International stature. The successful candidate will also demonstrate a deep-seated passion for our organizational culture and brand aspiration of "Greening Africa One Project at a Time". The capacity to diligently, efficiently and effectively manage complex projects, timelines and scenarios will need to be clearly demonstrated as will an inspirational, can-do and people focused leadership ability. Core qualifications, skills sets and experience must include:

Species Identification: Ability to identify various bird and bat species based on visual and auditory cues.
Monitoring Techniques: Proficiency in using monitoring tools.
Data Collection: Experience in collecting and recording data on bird and bat populations, behaviours and habitats.
Habitat Assessment: Knowledge of different habitats preferred by birds and bats, and ability to assess habitat quality and suitability for these species.
Fieldwork Skills: Strong skills in conducting field surveys, including setting up monitoring stations, conducting transects, and following standardized protocols.
Data Analysis: Capability to analyse monitoring data using statistical tools and software to draw conclusions and make recommendations.
Report Writing: Effective communication skills to document findings, prepare reports, and present results to stakeholders.
Conservation Knowledge: Understanding of conservation issues affecting bird and bat populations, and knowledge of conservation strategies and practices.
Safety Awareness: Adherence to safety protocols while working in the field, including awareness of risks such as wildlife encounters and environmental hazards.

 The position is in-house, and Cape Town based and may include travel across Africa.

Key Responsibilities:

Welcoming and assisting patients upon arrival.
Managing patient bookings, phone calls, and email inquiries.
Maintaining patient records and ensuring their confidentiality.
Coordinating with medical staff and other departments within the hospital.
Handling general office administration tasks.

Requirements:

Proven experience as a receptionist or in an administrative role within the medical field, preferably in radiology.
Proficiency in using medical software for scheduling and patient record management.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

Core qualifications, skills sets, and experience must include:

Post Graduate Science degree in environmental field
Must have successfully managed and completed (as a lead EAP) at least BA or S&EIA Application Processes
Must be EAPSA registered
Must be a Team player
Critical thinking and obsessive attention to detail
Good project management and people skills
Exemplary work ethic and not afraid to muck in to get the job done
Must be tough and have the ability to beat deadlines
A competent and thorough understanding of all SEMA's and associated regulations
A solid understanding of the renewable energy sector, challenges and opportunities

Responsibilities & Duties

Analyzing and interpreting the requests to ensure the classification, prioritization and escalation of the requests are correct.

Salary: 20-25k

OVERVIEWThe fulltime supervision and management (from plant to pit) for the preparation, installation, and construction of:

In-pit deposits (Tailings Storage Facility)
All related civil earthworks e.g. excavations, dozing
Slurry / re-mine pipelines
Concrete works.

 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Site Supervision
Site Quality Control Management
Programme/Project Management
Technical advice
Inspections
Progress reports
Ensure compliance to all Safety, Health and Environmental rules of the site.
Consult, interact with clients to optimize operating specifications
Adhere to company / client policies and procedures which may be amended from time to time.
To assume other duties as may be assigned by the Client / Managing Director.

TECHNICAL AND PROFESSIONAL COMPETENCIES

Excellent written and verbal communications skills.
A valid Code 14 drivers’ license
Computer literate (MS Office; Autocad/Prokon; Projects)
Ability to maintain sound interpersonal relations with Client, Company
Problem solving skills
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Ability to plan, lead, execute and organize tasks.
Management, supervisory, communication skills.

REQUIREMENTS

BSc/B Eng/BTech in Civil Engineering
ECSA registered
Minimum 3 years’ experience in a similar role within the mining environment
Clean record with valid COF or the ability to obtain a certificate of fitness
Able to commence duties on short notice.

 Salary:  R45-50,000.00 based on experience

Why Join Us?

Be part of a forward-thinking company that values expertise and excellence.
Work from anywhere in South Africa, providing flexibility and freedom.
Engage with a supportive team committed to your success.

If you meet the above criteria and are ready to take on this rewarding challenge, we invite you to express your interest by applying today

Minimum Qualifications:Must have Grade 12 or equivalent Must be fluent in Afrikaans and English Previous Counter Sales will be an advantage Previous technical / paint counter sales experience will be an added advantage Energetic, hardworking, diligent individual
